title: Why Is My Home Screen Blurry? 6 Easy Steps to Unblur It

steps.title: Unlock your iPhone
steps.content: Unlock your iPhone . Enter your passcode , Face ID, or touch ID. Your iPhone must be unlocked to edit the lock and home screen. Stay on the lock screen; don't swipe up just yet. iOS 16 and later allows you to add a blur to your home screen.

steps.title: Long-press on the lock screen.
steps.content: Long-press on the lock screen. When your iPhone is unlocked, this will open the Edit menu. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Customize.
steps.content: Tap Customize . This is below the wallpaper you want to customize. [2] X Research source If you want to change a different wallpaper , tap the blue + icon to add a new one, or swipe left/right to find a previously added one. [3] X Research source The Customize view will open with the lock screen on the left and the home screen on the right.

steps.title: Tap the home screen.
steps.content: Tap the home screen. This is on the right side of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Blur.
steps.content: Tap Blur . You can find this at the bottom-right corner, underneath a water droplet icon. [4] X Research source The home screen will be unblurred. If the photo is still blurry, you may need one of a higher resolution . You can also use one of Apple's background options.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . This will save your settings. If needed, tap the lock screen again to exit out of Customize mode. [5] X Research source
